question: 偽装
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: Some <kanji>fake</kanji> <kanji>attire</kanji> doesn't make you look fake, it makes you disappear. This fake attire is fake surroundings. So, if you're in a shrub, it's shrub attire. If you're in the darkness, it's dark attire. This is <vocabulary>camouflage</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
